div1.p:
I take this opportunity of informing you that Hesekiah House Mr Burre has purchased and myself has purchased our half of Sir Richard for which we gave $2000.- he is ⁁ a gray 15 hand 3 inches high and one of the most splendid and high formed horses you ever saw, he has run all distances ⁁and never been beat he has had to repeat the 3 mile heats 4 times before winning, tho he was not in order he is full brother to Monsheer Tonson now in virginia that run so successful in this state Louisana & Virginia and now standing in virginia at $50 —this season, he is aso full brother to champion that belong to Coln Kemp — Is this W.R. King There was an exabition of fine horses at murfresboro on monday at court, I heard several saying from account they expected to see a very fine horse, but they ware amased in seeing a much finer and a more splended horse than they could posible imagine existed there ware 11 or 12 horses exhibited, but richard
the admirers, and it was a unanimous exclamation that he was the finest and most splendid horse they ever saw, he will stand the ensuing season at P.J. Burrus, near Murfreesboro, upon the terms stated in the enclosed lines, ( I would have sent you a hand bill if had an oportunity) If you have any fine mares I should like for you to send them over to him, and leave them with me, and they shall be strictly attended to, I also solicite your influence in procuring some of the best bluded mares in your section and neighbourhood, believing and hoping that all those that patronese sir richard, ⁁ they will be highly gratified with his progeny and abundantly rewarded say to Coln King to make all the interest he can for me. with those that raisee fine horses and to send 2 or 3 of his own as he is fond of —fine horses — tell Henry to write to me, if you are not two much engaged I shoul be glad to see you here —
